alert.note: Alert for Lampasas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 6:23PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lampasas County through 700 PM CDT... At 623 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Evant, or 16 miles northwest of Lampasas, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Lampasas County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
